subroutines.description: Take toothbrush
Add pea-sized amount of toothpaste to brush
Brush your teeth carefully on all sides
Rinse mouth and toothbrush
Set the toothbrush to dry
Sort the biowaste into your own container or biodegradable bag
Sort metal, glass, paper and cardboard waste separately
Sort other waste that does not contain hazardous waste in a mixed waste bag
Close full garbage bag
Take the garbage to a waste collection point and sort into the correct containers
Place a new garbage bag in the waste container
Sort laundry into light, dark and white
Sort the laundry according to the washing method and temperature
Empty the pockets and close the zippers
Check the washing instructions for each cloth
Put the laundry in the washing machine
Dispense laundry detergent according to the laundry
Select the washing program according to the laundry
Check that the tap of the washing machine is open
Close the washing machine door and start washing machine
Wait for the washing program to end
Turn off the power and turn off the water tap
Take the laundry out of the washing machine. Leave the machine door and detergent drawer open
Straighten the laundry
Hang airily to dry or use a tumble dryer
Leave the bathroom door open for drying if you are drying laundry there
If your hands are sensitive to detergent or hot water, wear rubber or plastic protective gloves
Remove food residues from the dishes. Pre-rinse them with cool or hand-warm running water if necessary
If necessary, place the cooking and serving utensils to soak
Fill the sink to half with as hot water as your hands allow
Dispense the dishwashing detergent as instructed, usually a small pressing is sufficient
Fill the rinsing sink with as how water as your hands can hold
Wash the dishes from inside and outside with a dish brush and flush the rinse sink
Place the dishes in the airing cupboard to dry
Rinse the dish brush and drain the water from the sinks
Place the dish brush and sink's plug to dry
Wipe the sink and back wall
Make sure the dishes are machine washable
Remove food scraps from the dishes
Dishes may not always need to be rinsed before machine washing
Put the dishes in the baskets according to the instructions
Do not place plastic containers near heating elements
Dispense the detergent according to the instructions
Choose the right washing program
When there are dirty dishes in the machine, keep the door closed. This way the dirt does not dry out so easily on the surface of the dishes
Empty and clean the waste strainer regularly. Also check the cleanliness of the shower arms
Wipe the door surface regularly
Always turn off the water tap after washing. Do not leave the machine unattended
When washing is complete, allow the glasses to cool slightly before stacking them on top of each other. That way, they donâ€™t stick together and break
Wipe the worktops and stove with a damp cloth. You can use a kitchen cleaner
Wipe the cabinet doors
Clean cabinet surfaces if they are dirty
Vacuum the kitchen floor
Flush the toilet. Spray detergent on the the toilet bowl's walls.
Brush the inside of the toilet with a toilet brush. Also brush the bottom of the toilet from under the water as well as the top edge and water inlet area
Flush the toilet. Rinse the brush at the same time
Dip a cleaning cloth into the cleaning solution and wipe the pull button, water tank, lid and seat ring from both sides
Wipe the foot of the toilet seat and the floor around the seat
Wipe the walls around the seat from a splash height
Be sure to wash the cleaning cloth and let it dry
Wipe the mirror with a lint-free damp or damp cloth. If necessary, dry with a window cloth
If necessary, wipe the mirror shelf, bathroom cabinet doors, door handles and light switches
Wash the sink with a non-scratch sponge or a dish brush
Wipe the hand shower and pool area from splash height with a damp cleaning cloth
Wash faucets, hand shower and shower hose from the shower area
Wash the surrounding wall surface as well as glass and plastic shower walls
